subject: Re: [junit] using inner classes to factor out common tests?
msgSnippet: So said  Greg Wilson  on  2002-11-26 ...  ...  Abstract Test Case with an implementation for each particular fixture. Exclude the abstract test
messageBody:
So said Greg Wilson on 2002-11-26

>So, I want to test a reflexive, associative binary operator (rectangle
>overlap). I know that for any two valid rectangles A and B:
>
>A * A = A
>A * B = R // for some overlap result R
>B * A = R // the same R
>B * B = B
>
<snip />

>However, this still isn't trying all four possible tests on each
>fixture.
<snip />

Abstract Test Case with an implementation for each particular fixture.
Exclude the abstract test case from your test runner (however you run
your tests).

abstract class OverlapTestCase extends TestCase {
abstract Rectangle makeRectangleA();
abstract Rectangle makeRectangleB();

testCommonProperty1() {
// Use makeRectangle*() to make rectangles
// assertions...
}
...
}

Get the idea?
